meanings.sent1: The children rolled down the nole in the park.
meanings.sent2: The nole was covered in green grass.
meanings.sent3: The nole looked like a tiny mountain to the ants.
meanings.sent4: The nole stood proudly amidst the flat landscape.
meanings.sent5: The nole provided a perfect spot for a picnic.

meanings.definition: To push or thrust with the horns.
meanings.sent1: The bull tried to nole the other one during the fight.
meanings.sent2: The ram would often nole the fence in the pasture.
meanings.sent3: The playful goats would pretend to nole each other gently.
meanings.sent4: The rhinoceros can nole with incredible force.
meanings.sent5: The buffalo noled the log out of its way.

meanings.sent1: The nole jutted out into the sea, creating a beautiful view.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen gathered at the end of the nole to catch fish.
meanings.sent3: The birds perched on the nole, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: The nole stretched out like a welcoming arm into the water.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse was built at the tip of the nole for ships to see.
